abstract: The National Development and Reform Commission said the $975 million punishment was not designed to ‘‘protect any industry, but more importantly to restore market competitiveness.’’
snippet: The National Development and Reform Commission said the $975 million punishment was not designed to ‘‘protect any industry, but more importantly to restore market competitiveness.’’
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — China’s antimonopoly regulator sought on Tuesday to defend its $975 million fine against the chip maker Qualcomm, saying in a news conference that the punishment was not designed to ‘‘protect any industry, but more importantly to restore market competitiveness.’’

headline.main: Chinese Regulator Defends Fine Against Qualcomm

byline.original: By Paul Mozur and Shanshan Wang

abstract: The Chinese property and entertainment conglomerate has purchased a 68.2 percent stake in Infront Sports and Media from Bridgepoint, a European private equity firm.
snippet: The Chinese property and entertainment conglomerate has purchased a 68.2 percent stake in Infront Sports and Media from Bridgepoint, a European private equity firm.
lead_paragraph: BEIJING — The Dalian Wanda Group, the Chinese property and entertainment conglomerate, signed an agreement on Tuesday to buy  the sports marketing company Infront Sports and Media for $1.2 billion.

headline.main: Wanda Group to Buy Marketing Firm for $1.2 Billion

abstract: In addition to the fine, which was a record for China, Qualcomm, the chip maker, agreed to sharply reduce the royalties it charges Chinese smartphone makers.
snippet: In addition to the fine, which was a record for China, Qualcomm, the chip maker, agreed to sharply reduce the royalties it charges Chinese smartphone makers.
lead_paragraph: In the last decade, foreign technology companies have plowed billions into China in the hopes of tapping into a fast-growing market. Now that the country has the world’s largest number of Internet users and its biggest smartphone market, multinationals are bumping into a regulatory ceiling, Paul Mozur and Quentin Hardy report.

headline.main: Daily Report: Qualcomm Fined $975 Million by China

abstract: Hang Seng Bank, the lender controlled by HSBC, agreed on Tuesday to sell about half its stake in Industrial Bank of China for as much as $2 billion.
snippet: Hang Seng Bank, the lender controlled by HSBC, agreed on Tuesday to sell about half its stake in Industrial Bank of China for as much as $2 billion.
lead_paragraph: Hang Seng Bank, the lender controlled by HSBC, agreed on Tuesday to sell about half its stake in Industrial Bank of China for as much as $2 billion.

headline.main: Hang Seng Bank to Sell Part of Stake in Industrial Bank of China
